doc.after: Appalachian English is the southern subdialect of Midland American English It is spoken primarily in the Central and Southern Appalachian Mountain region of the Eastern United States namely in North Georgia Northwestern South Carolina Central and Southern West Virginia Southwestern Virginia Southern and Eastern Ohio Eastern Kentucky the Upper Potomac and Shenandoah Valleys of Virginia and West Virginia Western Maryland East Tennessee Western North Carolina and Northeastern Alabama While most of this area lies within Appalachia as defined by the Appalachian Regional Commission Appalachian English is not the dialect of the entire region the Commission defines as Appalachia The Appalachian dialect is rhotic and characterized by distinct phonology morphology syntax and lexicon It is mostly oral but can also be found in writing
